alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 12:55PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs and central Fremont Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1253 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Thermopolis, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Hot Springs and central Fremont Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton. Persons in campgrounds near the Wind River Canyon and Boysen Reservoir should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin
